remarks: Well-ordering theorem: any set ` A ` can be well-ordered.  This is an equivalent of the Axiom of Choice.  Theorem 6 of [Suppes] p. 242.  First proved by Ernst Zermelo (the "Z" in ZFC) in 1904.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-Jan-2013.)
statement:
weth $p |- ( A e. V -> E. x x We A ) $.
$d A x $.
